channel.title: Feature Request: Integrate vramfs or similar
channel.description: Any chance we can get kicksecure/whonix live run to use a gpu vram ramdisk? Currently, I use whonix vms running on a windows host with virtualbox running from a gpuramdisk. It's fast and saves me a ton of system ram. Swapping windows for a lightweight live run linux would be nice. Haven't found too much on people booting initrd to gpu ram though.

item.title: Feature Request: Integrate vramfs or similar
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Only normal RAM but Live Mode is possible. See:

Kicksecure – 11 Apr 23

Live Mode for Kicksecure ™

Read-only mode. Make all writes go to non-persistent memory (RAM) instead of the hard disk.

As for running Kicksecure inside a GPU ramdisk, this is highly unlikely to be invented by the Kicksecure project anytime soon. It might be possible as per:

Kicksecure – 12 Apr 23

Self Support First Policy for Kicksecure ™

Definition of the Self Support First Policy for Kicksecure ™

This should be unspecific to Kicksecure. If you can boot any (Debian) based (Linux) operating system into GPU RAM, then the same mechanism might work for Kicksecure.

Kicksecure – 13 Apr 23

Information Booster might be Available!

Utilizing other resources to help solve questions/issues unspecific to Kicksecure ™.
